trans-unit.source: Azure Storage Services Versions 2014-02-14 and Earlier
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage Services Versions 2014-02-14 and Earlier

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Azure storage services support multiple versions.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Azure storage services support multiple versions.

trans-unit.source: To make a request against the storage services, you must specify the version that you want to use for that operation, unless the request is anonymous.
trans-unit.target: To make a request against the storage services, you must specify the version that you want to use for that operation, unless the request is anonymous.

trans-unit.source: Available Versions
trans-unit.target: Available Versions

trans-unit.source: The current version of the Azure storage services is 2015-02-21, and using that version is recommended where possible.
trans-unit.target: The current version of the Azure storage services is 2015-02-21, and using that version is recommended where possible.

trans-unit.source: For information about the latest version, see <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versioning for the Azure Storage Services</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about the latest version, see <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versioning for the Azure Storage Services</link>.

trans-unit.source: Additional supported versions are listed below.
trans-unit.target: Additional supported versions are listed below.

trans-unit.source: Requests Authenticated via a Shared Access Signature (SAS)
trans-unit.target: Requests Authenticated via a Shared Access Signature (SAS)

trans-unit.source: A request made via a SAS is processed according to which service version was used to generate the SAS.
trans-unit.target: A request made via a SAS is processed according to which service version was used to generate the SAS.

trans-unit.source: Versions 2013-08-15 and 2012-02-12 include a versioning parameter (<parameterReference>SignedVersion</parameterReference>, or <parameterReference>sv</parameterReference>), which specifies which version to use to authenticate and execute the SAS request.
trans-unit.target: Versions 2013-08-15 and 2012-02-12 include a versioning parameter (<parameterReference>SignedVersion</parameterReference>, or <parameterReference>sv</parameterReference>), which specifies which version to use to authenticate and execute the SAS request.

trans-unit.source: Requests with Shared Access Signatures (SAS) generated using version 2013-08-15 or 2012-02-12 version require the <parameterReference>SignedVersion (sv)</parameterReference> parameter.
trans-unit.target: Requests with Shared Access Signatures (SAS) generated using version 2013-08-15 or 2012-02-12 version require the <parameterReference>SignedVersion (sv)</parameterReference> parameter.

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>SignedVersion</parameterReference> indicates the service version used for authentication and authorization and for calling the API operation.
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>SignedVersion</parameterReference> indicates the service version used for authentication and authorization and for calling the API operation.

trans-unit.source: If the <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header is passed on the request, it is ignored; only the <parameterReference>SignedVersion (sv)</parameterReference> parameter determines the service version to use to process the request made via the SAS.
trans-unit.target: If the <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header is passed on the request, it is ignored; only the <parameterReference>SignedVersion (sv)</parameterReference> parameter determines the service version to use to process the request made via the SAS.

trans-unit.source: For version 2013-08-15 and earlier, code that prepares and distributes shared access signature URLs (<legacyItalic>i.e.</legacyItalic>, SAS providers or generators) should specify versions that are understood by client software (<legacyItalic>i.e.</legacyItalic>, SAS consumers) that makes storage service requests.
trans-unit.target: For version 2013-08-15 and earlier, code that prepares and distributes shared access signature URLs (<legacyItalic>i.e.</legacyItalic>, SAS providers or generators) should specify versions that are understood by client software (<legacyItalic>i.e.</legacyItalic>, SAS consumers) that makes storage service requests.

trans-unit.source: The following table indicates which version is used to authenticate the request and call the API operation for a request made via a SAS:
trans-unit.target: The following table indicates which version is used to authenticate the request and call the API operation for a request made via a SAS:

trans-unit.source: Value of x-ms-version header
trans-unit.target: Value of x-ms-version header

trans-unit.source: Value of signedversion parameter
trans-unit.target: Value of signedversion parameter

trans-unit.source: Version used for authentication and execution
trans-unit.target: Version used for authentication and execution

trans-unit.source: None
trans-unit.target: None

trans-unit.source: None
trans-unit.target: None

trans-unit.source: None
trans-unit.target: None

trans-unit.source: For the Table and Queue services, an error occurs, since the <parameterReference>SignedVersion</parameterReference> parameter is required.
trans-unit.target: For the Table and Queue services, an error occurs, since the <parameterReference>SignedVersion</parameterReference> parameter is required.

trans-unit.source: For the Blob service, see the section titled <embeddedLabel>Versions Prior to 2012-02-12 (Blob Service Only)</embeddedLabel> below.
trans-unit.target: For the Blob service, see the section titled <embeddedLabel>Versions Prior to 2012-02-12 (Blob Service Only)</embeddedLabel> below.

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: The following example shows a SAS which calls <link xlink:href="fa4760a6-5343-4aa1-b484-df823ce817e7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Blobs</link> using <codeInline>sv=2013-08-15</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows a SAS which calls <link xlink:href="fa4760a6-5343-4aa1-b484-df823ce817e7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Blobs</link> using <codeInline>sv=2013-08-15</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the service will authenticate, authorize, and execute using version 2013-08-15.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the service will authenticate, authorize, and execute using version 2013-08-15.

trans-unit.source: The response will not include the <languageKeyword>Url</languageKeyword> element under the <languageKeyword>Blob</languageKeyword> element, as it was removed in 2013-08-15 version.
trans-unit.target: The response will not include the <languageKeyword>Url</languageKeyword> element under the <languageKeyword>Blob</languageKeyword> element, as it was removed in 2013-08-15 version.

trans-unit.source: If a client application using a version of the Storage Client Library based on version 2012-02-12 makes a request using this SAS, the client would expect the <languageKeyword>Uri</languageKeyword> element and so would fail with a <languageKeyword>NullReferenceException</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: If a client application using a version of the Storage Client Library based on version 2012-02-12 makes a request using this SAS, the client would expect the <languageKeyword>Uri</languageKeyword> element and so would fail with a <languageKeyword>NullReferenceException</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: Versions Prior to 2012-02-12 (Blob Service Only)
trans-unit.target: Versions Prior to 2012-02-12 (Blob Service Only)

trans-unit.source: The Blob service introduced shared access signatures in version 2009-07-17, while the Table and Queue services introduced shared access signatures in version 2012-02-12, so SAS behavior prior to version 2012-02-12 applies only to the Blob service.
trans-unit.target: The Blob service introduced shared access signatures in version 2009-07-17, while the Table and Queue services introduced shared access signatures in version 2012-02-12, so SAS behavior prior to version 2012-02-12 applies only to the Blob service.

trans-unit.source: Version 2012-02-12 also introduced the <parameterReference>SignedVersion (sv)</parameterReference> parameter, which enables the SAS generator to specify the version to use to process the request.
trans-unit.target: Version 2012-02-12 also introduced the <parameterReference>SignedVersion (sv)</parameterReference> parameter, which enables the SAS generator to specify the version to use to process the request.

trans-unit.source: A SAS generated with a version prior to 2012-02-12 cannot specify the version to use to process the request and so relies on the rules outlined below.
trans-unit.target: A SAS generated with a version prior to 2012-02-12 cannot specify the version to use to process the request and so relies on the rules outlined below.

trans-unit.source: In versions prior to 2012-02-12, the following rules are used to process the SAS request for authentication, authorization, and API execution:
trans-unit.target: In versions prior to 2012-02-12, the following rules are used to process the SAS request for authentication, authorization, and API execution:

trans-unit.source: If the SAS request against the Blob service has a valid <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header, the earliest valid version (2009-07-17) is used to interpret the SAS parameters, and the version specified by <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> is used to perform the Blob service storage operation.
trans-unit.target: If the SAS request against the Blob service has a valid <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header, the earliest valid version (2009-07-17) is used to interpret the SAS parameters, and the version specified by <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> is used to perform the Blob service storage operation.

trans-unit.source: If the SAS request against the Blob service does not have an <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header and the owner has set the default version for this storage service type using <link xlink:href="65424a3c-ab49-4994-865c-827409598092" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Blob Service Properties</link>, version 2009-07-17 is used to interpret the SAS parameters and the owner-specified default version is used to perform the Blob service storage operation.
trans-unit.target: If the SAS request against the Blob service does not have an <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header and the owner has set the default version for this storage service type using <link xlink:href="65424a3c-ab49-4994-865c-827409598092" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Blob Service Properties</link>, version 2009-07-17 is used to interpret the SAS parameters and the owner-specified default version is used to perform the Blob service storage operation.

trans-unit.source: If the SAS request against the Blob service does not have an <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header and the owner has not set a default version, the Blob service uses the earliest valid version (2009-07-17) to interpret the SAS parameters.
trans-unit.target: If the SAS request against the Blob service does not have an <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header and the owner has not set a default version, the Blob service uses the earliest valid version (2009-07-17) to interpret the SAS parameters.

trans-unit.source: If the container is public and its access restrictions were set with a <link xlink:href="55958376-0879-4805-ace9-079d297ab3fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Container ACL</link> operation that used version 2009-09-19 or newer, version 2009-09-19 is used to perform the Blob service operation.
trans-unit.target: If the container is public and its access restrictions were set with a <link xlink:href="55958376-0879-4805-ace9-079d297ab3fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Container ACL</link> operation that used version 2009-09-19 or newer, version 2009-09-19 is used to perform the Blob service operation.

trans-unit.source: If the SAS request against the Blob service does not have an <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header and the owner has not set a default version, the Blob service uses the earliest valid version (2009-07-17) to interpret the SAS parameters.
trans-unit.target: If the SAS request against the Blob service does not have an <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header and the owner has not set a default version, the Blob service uses the earliest valid version (2009-07-17) to interpret the SAS parameters.

trans-unit.source: If the container access restrictions were not set with a <link xlink:href="55958376-0879-4805-ace9-079d297ab3fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Container ACL</link> operation that used version 2009-09-19 or newer, the Blob service operation is performed using the earliest version of the service.
trans-unit.target: If the container access restrictions were not set with a <link xlink:href="55958376-0879-4805-ace9-079d297ab3fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Container ACL</link> operation that used version 2009-09-19 or newer, the Blob service operation is performed using the earliest version of the service.

trans-unit.source: The following table applies the above rules to various scenarios, and assumes the <parameterReference>SignedVersion</parameterReference> parameter is not included.
trans-unit.target: The following table applies the above rules to various scenarios, and assumes the <parameterReference>SignedVersion</parameterReference> parameter is not included.

trans-unit.source: Value of x-ms-version header
trans-unit.target: Value of x-ms-version header

trans-unit.source: Version used to interpret SAS parameters for authentication and authorization for Blob service
trans-unit.target: Version used to interpret SAS parameters for authentication and authorization for Blob service

trans-unit.source: Version used to perform Blob service operation
trans-unit.target: Version used to perform Blob service operation

trans-unit.source: None
trans-unit.target: None

trans-unit.source: Earliest valid SAS version (2009-07-17)
trans-unit.target: Earliest valid SAS version (2009-07-17)

trans-unit.source: 2009-09-19 is used if the container was set to public by <link xlink:href="55958376-0879-4805-ace9-079d297ab3fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Container ACL</link> using version 2009-09-19 or newer; otherwise the earliest version of Blob service is used.
trans-unit.target: 2009-09-19 is used if the container was set to public by <link xlink:href="55958376-0879-4805-ace9-079d297ab3fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Container ACL</link> using version 2009-09-19 or newer; otherwise the earliest version of Blob service is used.

trans-unit.source: Earliest valid SAS version (2009-07-17)
trans-unit.target: Earliest valid SAS version (2009-07-17)

trans-unit.source: Any version XXXX-XX-XX
trans-unit.target: Any version XXXX-XX-XX

trans-unit.source: Earliest valid SAS version (2009-07-17)
trans-unit.target: Earliest valid SAS version (2009-07-17)

trans-unit.source: Version XXXX-XX-XX
trans-unit.target: Version XXXX-XX-XX

trans-unit.source: We highly recommend using version 2011-08-18 version and later for scenarios that require quoted ETag values or valid <parameterReference>Accept-Ranges</parameterReference> response headers, since browsers and other streaming clients require these for efficient download and retries.
trans-unit.target: We highly recommend using version 2011-08-18 version and later for scenarios that require quoted ETag values or valid <parameterReference>Accept-Ranges</parameterReference> response headers, since browsers and other streaming clients require these for efficient download and retries.
